column4: hi all, have an issue with ubuntu 10.04x64  it will not recognize my 8gigs of ram.  although it is recognized in the bios.  I am running Memtest86 at the moment, if the ram passes what else could be the problem?
can you give the output of: uname -a   please
can you give the -a output please
ok no worries, let it finish a test
sounds like a 32bit kernel to me
can you also give the output of: sudo apt-get -y install pastebinit; lsb_release -a     thanks
its easier, the pastebin command is dead handy
lsb_release -a | pastebinit
http://pastebin.com/ej0KdLcx  sorry haven't used irc much.. stll got a learning curve
try: cd /var/cache/apt/archives; file * | pastebinit
ok so they are all amd64 based
ok so where does that leave me?  Back to the memory test?  or could their be another culprit?
not sure fellah, could try reinstalling linux-image   then check the arch of the deb in the archives folder
http://pastebin.com/sXFTqFrV  does this mean anything to you? from a python script I found check-my-hardware.py
if you boot an older kernel is it ok?
you will have a few on the system by default, hold shift at boot and choose the older one
thats a release, not a kernel
nope same deal  http://pastebin.com/sXvPps9Y  the only older kernel I have is the .21
no idea then dude
